title: Ticket #7541: S3 uploads result in files unmodifiable by bucket owner
description:
Ian has an AWS account with permission to upload files to another account's S3 bucket. When he does so using HTCondor, the other account has no permissions on those files -- it can't even delete them, despite owning the containing bucket.

This is apparently a feature of S3, rather than a bug:

  • https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/example-bucket-policies.html#example-bucket-policies-use-case-8
  • https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/amazon-s3-policy-keys.html#grant-putobject-conditionally-1

(where the second bullet point in the second link seems like the better way).

However, even if the bucket's owner re-configures their permissions for Ian's account, HTCondor will need to be modified to upload files to the bucket with the required ACL (that is, granting permissions to the bucket owner).

In the short term, we should instead investigate the possibility of creating an IAM user under the bucket owner's account and having Ian use those credentials to do the upload.
